biography.bio: Dana Dinková was born on September 25, 1973 in Bratislava, Slovakia. She is an actress, known for Tábor padlych zien (1997), La belle au bois dormant (1990) and Duchovia (1997).
biography.name: Dana Dinková

biography.bio: Jozef Adamovic was born on April 23, 1939 in Trnava, Slovakia. He was an actor, known for Vivát, Benyovszky! (1975), La belle au bois dormant (1990) and The Mill (1971). He was married to Bozidara Turzonovová. He died on August 2, 2013 in Kosice, Slovakia.
biography.name: Jozef Adamovic

biography.placeOfBirth: Friedland in Oberschlesien, Upper Silesia, Germany [now Korfantów, Opolskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Judy Winter was born on January 4, 1944 in Friedland in Oberschlesien, Upper Silesia, Germany as Beate Richard. She is an actress, known for Love Is Only a Word (1971), Mutter muss weg (2012) and Woman Doctors (1984).
biography.name: Judy Winter

biography.bio: Born in Munich in 1969, Gedeon was raised bilingual (English & German). He was sent to boarding school in England at the age of 8 and transferred to American high school at the age of 12. Gedeon starred in his first movie (Aunt Maria) when he was 10, his second lead role followed one year later in the American / German co-production Blood and Honor (3 part mini series) as Hartmut Keller. By demand of the American and German Producers each scene was shot once in English and once in German, due to his bilingual upbringing, Gedeon was the only actor who did not have to be dubbed in either version. Gedeon continuously worked in various projects during school vacations until he dropped out of high school after 11th grade. At this time he concentrated on training for 2 years, attending musical school and taking speech and acting classes on the side. In 1988 Gedeon starred, next to Tony Curtis and Birol Head On by Fathi Akin), in the motion Picture Welcome to Germany which marked the beginning of his career as a grownup. Since then Gedeon has acted in numerous films, including Acting it Out (German film award/ Movie and Bavarian Film award/Actor) by acclaimed German director Wortman, Silence like Glass by Carl Schenkel and Making Up (Student Academy Award USA/German Film Award) by Katja von Garnier. He also starred in the internationally successful television series Detectiv Rex (sold to over 140 territories) and Kobra 11 (Action series, sold to over 120 territories). in 2006 Gedeon portrayed Henry Neumann, a Jewish boxer trapped in a boxcar with his family on the way to Auschwitz, in the motion picture The last Train. This challenging part, it seems, was the perfect preparation for the biggest opportunity in his career to date, the part of the Jewish Basterd (Will Wicky) in Quentin Tarantino's new movie Inglorious Basterds.
biography.name: Gedeon Burkhard

biography.bio: Karel Hermánek was born on October 17, 1947 in Prague, Czechoslovakia. He is an actor, known for Gympl s (r)ucením omezeným (2012), Stalingrad (1993) and Kolya (1996). He is married to Hana Hermánková. They have three children.
biography.name: Karel Hermánek

biography.bio: Milena Dvorská was born on September 7, 1938 in Prostejov, Czechoslovakia. She was an actress, known for Ulice (2005), Prague Nights (1969) and Stone Bridge (1996). She died on December 22, 2009 in Prague, Czech Republic.
biography.name: Milena Dvorská

biography.bio: Pavol Mikulík was born on March 2, 1944 in Presov, Czechoslovakia. He was an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), The Devil's Smile (1987) and The Curator of Outdoor Museum (1989). He died on November 28, 2007 in Bratislava, Slovakia.
biography.name: Pavol Mikulík

biography.bio: Zdena Studenková was born on May 19, 1954 in Bratislava, Czechoslovakia. She is an actress, known for Panelák (2008), Beauty and the Beast (1978) and Vsetko co mam rad (1993). She is married to Branislav Kostka. They have one child.
biography.name: Zdena Studenková
